bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, December 9, 1889

div1.p: Carter provides post news and informs her that he hopes to be home for Christmas.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, December 9, 1889
div1.opener:
MARINE HOSPITAL SERVICE
1798 * U. S. * 1871
Marine-Hospital Service,
Southern Atlantic District,
Surgeon's Office,
Port of Brunswick Ga
Dec 9, 189.
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
I am simply worried out, & feel hopeless,
I am trying to settle an account for the things
destroyed at the Branham house with its owner
who is without reason. I believe she thinks herself good
& c. but is the most selfish person, almost I have ever
seen. For myself I had rather spend three days in
the house with Jno. Branham dying than the
last three & the one I expect today. This is no exaggeration
I will if it please God finish soon; only
I have not received the book which con-
tains the account of things destroyed
I will of course come home as soon
as this thing is completed, least wise
I see no reason why I cannot.

I will come home as mentally sane as I would be
physically had I passed through a threshing ma-
chine.

I just haven't any heart in me
Will keep this until afternoon
when the train leaves & if I can
write differently will do so.

Please god I think things will
eventually end. My work today
was the best I have had & - the only bit of
gratitude I have had on this thing - Mrs Jno
Branham had a little boy (her father wrote)
named John Carter, Poor child. Poor child,
I have always been exceedingly sorry for her
get. Laura a birthday present for me
I will get home before Xmas that is about
all that I can say & I fear. I won't even be very
glad to get home; too depressed & worried
to be able to be glad for a month or six
weeks.

Give my love to the children & get
the Xmas things, No tree this year I suppose.
